  • Recognized for earning a 100% grade in Cross-Sectional Anatomy.

  • Recipient of the Walker Family Foundation, Sky Lakes Medical Center Volunteer, Sky Lakes Medical Center Endowed, and the Winston Purvine Presidential scholarships.


Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I chose Oregon Tech because of its prestigious programs in the field I wanted to pursue along with all the qualities I was looking for in a college. This school has an incredible reputation for its medical imaging degrees, which are the perfect combination of rigorous and rewarding. It maintains a small student to faculty ratio, and has an incredibly close sense of community among students and staff. Over the past four years, I have found that Oregon Tech was the perfect fit for me and would be a great college for anyone who values a quality education and a rewarding college experience.

What do you like most about your program?

The qualities of my program that I’ve enjoyed the most over the past four years have been the hands-on teaching style and the strong bonds that develop between students and professors. Since the first day I was accepted into the Nuclear Medicine Program, I have been learning not only through lectures, but through hands on being able to do the things I learn about in class, and not many schools are like that. Personally, I learn best by doing, so the lab portion of the program and the rotations done at Sky Lakes Medical Center made the material easier to understand and provided a beneficial “real-life” application. With only 15 students in my class, I think the sense of family has been my favorite part about my program. We all started out as complete strangers, but over time, we grew into one big family. I’ve made some of the best friends of my life in this program, and that has been my favorite part.  

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I am passionate about improving the patient care aspect of this field. Too many times patients in the medical field are viewed as just a number or a dollar sign by big corporations, and aren’t treated as actual people with issues and needs. My hope is to improve the patient care aspect of Nuclear Medicine by treating everyone with the respect and dignity they deserve. 

What would be your dream job?

My dream job would be working full-time in a Pacific Northwest hospital or clinic that has a large variety of Nuclear Medicine exams, quality patient interaction, and opportunities to participate in new research trials in the field. I have always been interested in up-and-coming technology, so working in a place that puts cutting-edge ideas to work while still providing quality patient care would be perfect for me. 

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

I think my favorite class has been Radiation Biophysics. I find the interactions between radiation and matter really interesting and the enthusiasm it was taught with made me excited to learn more about it as I continued through the program. Since our field involves the use of radiation every day, it is important to know the different interactions it has with human tissue and how to protect ourselves, which is what that class specialized in. 

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

I wish more people knew about the great professors at Oregon Tech. Since the class sizes are so small compared to other universities, your professors become close friends instead of just teachers. They have an immense passion for what they do, and that makes learning so much easier and more fun. During my 4 years at Oregon Tech, I have created relationships with my professors that will last long after I graduate. This is a huge, positive quality of Oregon Tech that sets it apart from other schools, and something I wish more people knew about. 

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

Currently I am on an 11-month externship at Peace Health Sacred Heart Medical Center in Springfield, Oregon. During my externship I have learned more about Nuclear Medicine than I ever thought was possible, and it has been such a priceless experience. In under a year, I gained an immense amount of knowledge in general Nuclear Medicine, SPECT, CT, and PET imaging along with scheduling, administration and patient care that will make me into a great technologist. The professors at Oregon Tech prepare you incredibly well for the field you are pursuing, but I learned so much more on my externship that I could never have learned on campus, and those skills are invaluable. 

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

After I graduate in June of 2018, I hope to find a full-time job in the Pacific Northwest, but I will go wherever a job presents itself. I plan to be a Nuclear Medicine technologist for quite a while, but I’ve also always been interested in pursuing research opportunities or going back to Oregon Tech to teach in the program I graduated from. 

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

I think my biggest piece of advice for incoming Oregon Tech students is to love every second of your experience here! It is a fantastic school, and the time goes far too quickly. People told me that college would fly by, but I never believed them. Now that I am just months from graduating, I have realized how right they were.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: Oregon Tech was the only school that offered what I was looking for in terms of the breadth of the program and approach of the instructors.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I have always wanted to learn how to write code. Oregon Tech was the only school that offered what I was looking for in terms of the breadth of the program and approach of the instructors. I learn best by diving right into the base principles of how something works and OIT starts you from the ground up.

What do you like most about your program?

The instructors are all great. Whenever I have a question they are glad to take the time to answer it in a way that makes sense to me. The amount of knowledge that many of the professors have is incredible. I have found that I can learn an immense amount from them. 

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why? 

I am interested in taking new technologies and making them useful to everyday users. I am particularly interested in block chain development. Block chain is the technology that Bitcoin sits on top of. It is very exciting to work on projects and technology that have the potential to create positive change in the world. 

What would be your dream job? 

Currently my dream job is to start a company with my family and friends. I would like to develop software related to either deep learning or block chain. Artificial intelligence is hot right now, it would a blast to be part of a team developing autonomous vehicles or software that can play GO. 

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

Data structures was great because we developed a few games. It was awesome to be able to show my friends and family the games that I made for the class. Junior project is great too. Working on a team can be a ton of fun and it is exciting to build a unique project chosen by me and my team. 

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about? 

I didn’t know it before I got here; Oregon Tech has an excellent reputation. Many of my friends have received internships or full-time positions at great companies. Oregon Tech grads have no trouble finding work. 

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

After graduation I plan on applying to a few grad schools. I would like to continue my education and gain competency in a more specialized part of the field.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else? 

Oregon Tech provides an excellent education and the culture on campus is both friendly and professional. I am very happy with my decision to attend Oregon Tech. I started at Pioneer Pacific in the IT program. Pioneer is the school across the street from the Wilsonville OIT campus. It was somewhat of a dream of mine to attend OIT, it seemed like the emerald city to me. I worked through a few courses at Chemeketa community college and got accepted into the CSET program at OIT. I feel that OIT has given me so much opportunity to write my own destiny in terms of my career.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: The lab portions for each subject provide an excellent opportunity to practice everything we cover in lecture, and I love being able to obtain hands on experience.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I chose Oregon Tech because the Medical Laboratory Science program at Oregon Tech is the only accredited training program for Medical Laboratory Scientist in the state of Oregon. It is a joint program between Oregon Tech and Oregon Health and Science University (OHSU), and both of these institutions carry an excellent reputation. The 16-week externship, coupled with the academic reputation of both universities, was the key selling point for me. 

What do you like most about your program?

One of my favorite things about the program is the dedicated professors. Each of them is enthusiastic about their areas of expertise. The lab portions for each subject provide an excellent opportunity to practice everything we cover in lecture, and I love being able to obtain hands on experience.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

From my understanding, my cohort and general field is predominantly white. I look forward to further helping bring diversity to this particular field and further spread awareness about this fulfilling program.

What would be your dream job?

I was born in Portland and I love the city. My dream job would be to have a position with (OHSU). This way I could help the community I have come to love whilst living in a part of the country that has so much outdoor activities to offer.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

So far, my favorite class has been Immunology. I am used to laboratory bench work from my position at a toxicology lab, so I loved learning new lab tests and techniques in Immunology lab.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

After briefly witnessing other programs' classrooms and meeting some of the other students, I want everyone to know that Oregon Tech teaches everyone in very hands on methods. Visitors would even be able to walk by and see all the cool labs from the different programs.

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

I will be participating in a 16-week long externship during the fall of 2018.

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

I graduate after my externship. I will have had the opportunity to practice everything I have learned in a clinical setting. And I hope this experience will better prepare me as a potential candidate for a full-time position with OHSU.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: I want to bring renewable energy to the consumer and to the commercial user.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I actually chose the Oregon Institute of Technology for the Renewable Energy Engineering degree program. I completed a freshman year at the University of Colorado at Colorado Springs, but did not connect with a degree program. 5 years later, I heard about Oregon Tech, then immediately moved to Klamath Falls.

What do you like most about your program?

I like all of the hands on experience and the in-depth physics and mathematics covering renewable energy concepts I have received during my 4 years at OIT. Students in the REE program have a large amount of lab work to complete, and sometimes 6 projects per term. I have also been fortunate to find like-minded students within my program to do homework with and hangout with during school.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I want to bring renewable energy to the consumer, and to the commercial user. There is so much free energy just lying around, waiting to be extracted for our uses. We need to quit thinking of solely large windmill farms and huge solar arrays when we think of renewable energy. Anyone can implement sustainable energy practices; we just need to be informed how to do it.

What would be your dream job?

Owning my own Renewable Energy company that helps people and business implement sustainable energy technologies.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

I loved REE 243 and REE 253. These cover motors and generators, and the introduction of power transmission. This is the bread and butter of renewable energy. Then actual REE applications like Batteries, Wind Power, Geothermal Power, Electronics, Thermodynamics, Fluids, etc... are all fascinating.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

We might not be in Portland, OR, but that is a good thing. We have less big city distractions, and have more time to get school work done. Instead of clubbing, we can do projects. We are also in a great test site for solar, geothermal, and wind energy resources. This is an ideal place to seclude yourself and learn renewable energy engineering.

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

I was recently elected the President of my school club, the Association of Energy Engineers. We were formerly the Renewable Energy Engineering Club, but we decided to change our name to become more inclusive and multidisciplinary. We complete student projects every term, and go on school field trips to power plants and networking events.

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

I have not participated in any internships so far while at Oregon Tech. However, I have gone to a large networking event of professionals in Portland called the Oregon Solar Energy Conference, and have visited Sequential Biofuels, the largest biodiesel manufacturing plant in Oregon. I have been to the Shasta Hydro Electric Dam twice, and have had numerous tours of the on campus geothermal plant and 2 MW solar array. All of these have taught me valuable real world experience.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

  1. Involve yourself with independent research while at OIT.
  2. Join some type of school organization or school club.
  3. Find friends to do study with

StudentProfile.TeaserText: I would like to bring new technologies and ideas towards expedition type operations.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I chose Oregon Tech because I live local and wanted to use my GI bill®, but didn’t want to waste it on a random degree as I already have a degree in nuclear engineering.  Renewable energy engineering is a field with great promise for the future; if I choose to re-enter the workforce when I complete my degree. I’m using the information I gain to help reduce my carbon foot print and eventually be able to live fully off the grid, energy companies are too greedy and I want to be out from under their thumb.

What do you like most about your program?

What I do like about Oregon Tech in general is the class size and eagerness of professors to help and be involved.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I would like to bring new technologies and ideas towards expedition type operations.  This would help reduce the carbon footprint and make energy management much easier in remote places such as the Himalayas and Patagonia.

What would be your dream job?

My dream job is to not work, but if I had the opportunity I would like to start something along the lines of an adventure camp carbon footprint reduction consulting. Consult with major expedition funders and companies to give them tools necessary to reduce their footprint. 

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

Math classes are my favorite because they are straight forward.  Either you know it or you don’t, and you don’t have to write papers. 

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

The hiking in this area is superb but I already knew that, I just wish more people knew that.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: I choose Oregon Tech because of their reputation, they are known for their great ultrasound programs.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I choose Oregon Tech because of their reputation, they are known for their great ultrasound programs. Along with the great ultrasound programs, it wasn’t too far from home and on top of that, I was able to run on the Oregon Tech track team.

What do you like most about your program?

I love how hands on my program is, we get to practice scanning real people every day. I also love that the program is small and that you really get to know your classmates as well as professors.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

In the echo field you essentially get to save people lives by discovering heart abnormalities before they cause further damage. Helping better the lives of others is something that really drew me to this field.

What would be your dream job?

At this point I’m not really sure what my dream job would be, I would really like to try a little bit of everything, maybe even venture out into some of the other ultrasound modalities someday. 

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

My favorite classes have been the echo classes because they have a scanning lab with them, the scanning lab is always fun. I got to practice scanning for three straight hours, and I always enjoyed improving my scanning.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

I wish everyone knew how great the programs are here. Your program really starts to feel like your family here in Klamath Falls; they are always there to encourage and support you.

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

My first three years at Oregon Tech I ran on the track team. I really enjoyed my time on the track team, it helped me stay focused by managing school and sports. I definitely recommend getting involved in sports or clubs! 

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

I will begin my 11-month externship this July. I’m really looking forward to all the experience that I will gain with externship. I can’t wait to be scanning real patients and learning new things every day.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: Being able to work on projects based on real life situations is useful for when the problem shows up in a real working situation.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

My dad, my brother, and sister-in-law graduated from Oregon Tech and they told me how great the school was. I did research on Oregon Tech, but once I was able to take a tour of the school, I knew it was the school for me.

What do you like most about your program?

I really like the hands-on work and real-life projects. The projects on based on real life situations that are going to happen at some point in my field. Being able to work on projects based on real life situations is useful for when the problem shows up in a real working situation. 

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I am passionate about changing people’s views on what information technology is. Information technology is much more than the people who fix the computer when it breaks. Information technology is used for making decisions on everything in businesses. Information technology supports business.

What would be your dream job?

My dream job is to become an IT specialist. Being an IT specialist would allow me to help others out and keep me on my toes with the work being different every day.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

I have really enjoyed the C# programming classes. I love making programs and troubleshooting the code for issues. There’s a joy that comes from getting a program to run with no errors that can’t be explained.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

Oregon Tech is much more than an engineering and medical school. Oregon Tech has a great business department that offers great degrees like marketing, management, health informatics, and information technology to name a few. I also want to mention that having small class sizes allows for students to get to know their professors and classmates and build connections with them.

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

I work at the athletics department taking tickets for the sporting event. I really like the job because I am able to meet tons of new people. I’m also a tutor at the peer consulting center. I tutor in information technology and help students out with programming and other IT classes.

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

I got an internship at Betty Lou’s Inc. the summer of 2017. It was a great experience and really got me excited to work in the field. I was able to demonstrate the skills I learned at Oregon Tech and even learn new skills.

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

After graduation, I hope to get a job in Washington where I am able to display the skills that I have learned and work my way up the ladder to get to my dream job as an IT specialist.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

The classes aren’t easy, but the professors, classmates, and other faculty around the campus are here to make sure you succeed. Nobody wants to see you fail and are here to help you if you ask for it. I also want to mention that Oregon Tech has some great sports and you should definitely go to the sporting events.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: I like having teachers that have been vastly successful in the workforce already, they bring much needed insight into this complicated industry of tech.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Awards/Accomplishments while at Oregon Tech: President's list for Fall 2017

Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I chose Oregon Tech because it works excellent with my full time work schedule and is the exact training path for my future career in the IT industry.

What do you like most about your program?

I like having teachers that have been vastly successful in the workforce already, they bring much needed insight into this complicated industry of tech.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I am passionate about changing the culture of the IT person being a closed off introvert, that you know you need around but steer clear of at the water cooler. I want to incorporate a culture of influence and professionalism for the IT guy to help make them a very valuable member of the corporate team. 

What would be your dream job?

Dream job right now would to be a Chief Security Officer for a corporation/government body that wants to stay a head of the latest security threats, and be at the forefront of a healthy defensive security posture.  

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

My favorite classes were Networking II and Information Security, both with Kris Rosenberg.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

This is the place to be if you are serious about being in the IT workforce.

Are you involved on campus?If so, how?

I am a part of the Cyber Security club that started last fall. 

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

I am currently employed full time, and am looking for ever expanding work opportunities before and after graduation. 

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

I wish that I knew exactly what I wanted to do sooner in life. I did waste some time pursuing a degree in History that did not amount for much. I have always been very fascinated with technology and to be studying and learning what your passionate about the most, is the best way to learn.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: The program provides an excellent multi-faceted approach to understanding business concepts and information through real world practical applications.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Awards/Accomplishments while at Oregon Tech: President's list since Jan 2017

Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

The renewable energy engineering program is the primary reason for choosing OIT, however after working through half of the program it became clear that engineering was not my calling and switched to the technology and management program where I have thrived.

What do you like most about your program?

The ability to gain knowledge in a multitude of different fields surrounding technology. The program provides an excellent multi-faceted approach to understanding business concepts and information through real world practical applications.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

The way local communities in the NW deal with their waste. We dispose of our waste in such an inefficient manner and our current throw away mentality is unsustainable. I would like to help communities turn waste into energy and usable products for sustainable plant based food production. 

What would be your dream job?

While attending a bio-fuel conference in Portland, I saw a presentation from Amy McCrae Kessler, whose company, Turning Earth, has an integrated system for organic waste that creates natural gas for energy and fertilizer for their onsite organic pesticide free industrial greenhouse. If I could start and manage a similar project in Lincoln city, that would be my dream job.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

The writing classes with Matthew Search have been my favorite and most challenging classes. They opened the door to research and knowledge and how to incorporate those into presentable material. 

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

The incredible amount of information and research materials available through the OIT library system. It has been invaluable in my continued standing on the President's list.

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

I have used the OIT resume building and researched job opportunities presented through Jobs4Owls. I have also attended and plan to attend Bio-fuel conferences to network and hopefully find a company with whom I can work to make my dream job happen

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

I would encourage them to make note and use all of the amazing resources OIT has to offer. Advising, counseling, laboratory, workshop, computer and library are all of the highest quality and are easily accessible.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: The extensive online class offering and support allows me the flexibility to complete my studies with a minimum impact on my family life.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I chose OIT for several reasons. OIT has a great reputation including national recognition. The extensive online class offering and support allows me the flexibility to complete my studies with a minimum impact on my family life. OIT also provides degree programs in the areas that I am interested in pursuing.

What do you like most about your program?

The subject areas are applicable to actual work scenarios and situations, rather than pure theory. The program also includes a broad range of content which will provide a strong, extensive base of knowledge.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I am excited about making a difference as I return to the workforce.  My focus is positive changes that provide a supportive, focused environment for employees and business activities.  

What would be your dream job?

I have two dream jobs. The first is starting and running my own company. The second is leading a nonprofit that is making a difference in our community.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

I was surprised by how much I enjoyed Corporate Finance. I have over 30 years of work experience, which may have given me an extensive background to relate to this class. The examples were very relevant and enlightening. Business Law and Business Ethics were also very interesting. Again, the examples and cases utilized in the studies were excellent. 

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

OIT provides the opportunity for a student to gain an excellent education in a range of studies. The class content is designed for success in the real world. Students willing to put in the effort will be prepared for success in their chosen field.

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

I am undecided on whether to rejoin the business world or attend graduate school. I do have aspirations to acquire a Master’s Degree in one of several business areas.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

The online class delivery and experience is much richer than I expected. I recommend that students that have difficulty attending classes on a campus consider the OIT online program.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: You’re going to have to work hard, the standards are high, but it will be well worth it!
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I chose Oregon Tech for its reputation and Environmental Sciences program. I liked that the class sizes were small and that an emphasis was placed on obtaining real world, hands on experience. I also liked that there were a variety of classes that would be offered to me, with many opportunities to get outside!

What do you like most about your program?

All the field trips that I have been able to go on - these have made some of the classes that I have really enjoyed even more fun, and have been a great opportunity for me to get to know my classmates and professors. I also enjoy the variety of classes offered in the program, since they have helped me explore the various fields within Environmental Sciences and allowed me to develop my interests and future goals. 

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I am passionate about changing how people view the environment as separate from us. This program has made me realize how connected we are to this planet, how much we have manipulated it, and how necessary it is to our survival. As a whole, people have moved away from how reliant we are upon the environment, and it is reflected upon how we treat it. While this is a big goal, I still have hope!

What would be your dream job?

My dream job would be working on the restoration of wetlands. Wetlands play a vital part in ecosystem stability, humans and wildlife depend and benefit from them, but they have taken a serious hit from development. I would like to have this job because it would combine the three things I really enjoy – botany, hydrology, and wildlife.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

My two favorite classes have been Ornithology and Botany. Ornithology was a blast because I got to learn about all the birds that come through the Klamath Basin and how to identify them, and went on an amazing field trip to the Hart Mountain National Antelope Refuge in Eastern Oregon, where we went hiking, soaked in hot springs, and birded along the way. Botany was a great class because I had to build an herbarium, which is a collection of preserved plant specimens, which gave me the opportunity to go hiking in search of different flowers, and because we took a trip to the Redwoods and California coast that I will never forget! Both of these classes were amazing because of the enthusiasm and passion of the professors, and because it gave me a greater appreciation for the beauty of the Klamath Basin.  

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

I obtained an internship the summer of 2016 as a Plant Ecology Research Assistant. This internship was local and it involved monitoring a Federally Endangered plant species that can only be found in Klamath Falls, and helping build rainfall shelters for an International Drought Experiment. I gained valuable experience from this internship, it helped me get accustomed to working long hours in the summer heat and taught me skills for working in the field.     

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

You’re going to have to work hard, the standards are high, but it will be well worth it!

StudentProfile.TeaserText: The faculty here care about your success and are a great resource to every student.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I chose Oregon Tech because of its close vicinity to my home in Klamath Falls, its low tuition cost, and of course the overwhelmingly positive experiences that my older brothers have had at the institution. All three of my older brothers chose Oregon Tech as their first college as well, and their path to success as a result of their education at Oregon Tech confirmed that this school is the right one for my academic and career goals.

What do you like most about your program?

I like how diverse and sociable all of the students and faculty are in the communication program. Because it is a relatively small program, the professors are determined to set each student on a path to success and are always willing to spend extra time to help you. And since the class sizes are often small, you can engage in meaningful discussions with your classmates and professor, which is not always possible in larger programs and universities. 

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

Since communication studies is often perceived as too broad or not worthwhile, I want to prove that this degree is an excellent choice for many different careers, especially since almost every career involves communication in some shape or form. The field is admittedly broad, but thanks to the help of OIT’s faculty, students can focus on specific aspects of the communication field that are most relevant to their career. For example, I want to become a teacher, so my advisor and professors have helped create a plan for me and my specific career goals. 

What would be your dream job?

My dream job would be teaching English to high school students. This job would involve everything I am passionate about: helping others, interacting with people daily, forming a sense of community, making a difference in young people’s lives, and sharing my love for writing and English. Earning my degree in communication studies (with classes focused on writing and literature) will allow me to then pursue a master’s in Secondary Education at another university. 

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

My favorite classes so far have all involved studying people in some way, such as my Interpersonal Communication class. In this class, we found examples of communication theories and applied them to modern day examples in various forms of media. I found that when I applied a theory from the textbook to someone memorable like Kanye West, I could understand these theories better and realize how they are relevant in our everyday lives.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

Everyone should know just how many free events there are at Oregon Tech. There is almost always something to go to each week, and more often than not, there is free food at these events! The information they provide is always useful as well, and I wish more students would attend. 

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

I have a few on-campus jobs at Oregon Tech, which make my life so much easier. Instead of having to travel to another part of town to get to work, I can just walk across campus after class and start working! I currently tutor writing to students at the Peer Consulting Center, edit and review essays that students submit online, and work at the Learning Resource Center’s help desk. I am also involved with OIT’s Circle K club, which gives me opportunities to volunteer and give back to the Klamath Falls community. 

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

After graduating, I plan to attend Southern Oregon University in order to obtain a degree in secondary education. With the help of my advisors at Oregon Tech, I will have completed all of my prerequisites for this degree.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

Oregon Tech’s small size is actually one of its biggest advantages. The faculty here care about your success and are a great resource to every student. Do not be afraid to ask them for help!

StudentProfile.TeaserText: The campus in Wilsonville is small, but there is a great community of people here.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Awards/Accomplishments while at Oregon Tech: President's List all terms, Outstanding Non-Traditional Student Nominee, Media Producer for TECH Talks 2016 and 2017, ASOIT Communications Officer 2016-17, and ASOIT President 2017-18

Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I was in Southern Oregon and looking for a bachelor's degree program in Health Informatics. Not only did Oregon Tech have this program available, but they also had a very high placement rate for employment after graduation. This meant moving from a place I had lived for 30 years, but the opportunities for employment in the Portland Metro area were so much better.

What do you like most about your program?

I like working on the team projects with other students the best. This is much more like a real work environment than just reading, doing homework, writing a paper, and taking tests. Group projects show me how talented the other students are in different ways. When we blend our strengths together, the projects turn out much larger than anything I could do myself.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I am passionate about protecting and improving patient access to healthcare. With the recent changes in healthcare policy, the future of our ability to get the healthcare we need when we need it is unsure. This means so much to me because my Mom is 93 and she is a retired nurse, and one of the reasons she has lived so long is that she always had good access to her choice of healthcare providers. I see so many people younger than her who are not doing so well and have difficulty with their health and paying healthcare bills. 

What would be your dream job?

My dream job would be to make a difference in the realm of healthcare access and improved patient record processes. I do have a job waiting for me when I graduate and in that job I will be helping medical facilities remain stable so that patients still have a choice of where they can get the care they need.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

My favorite classes have been Statistics, Healthcare Info Systems Management, Systems Analysis, and Lean Six Sigma. Statistics is just fun, I love seeing piles of data sliced and diced to prove or disprove assumptions. The other classes all involved team related activities, and those are the most gratifying for me to be a part of.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

I wish they knew that the Wilsonville campus is a valuable contributor to the workforce in highly specialized and high demand fields. We have a very active student government, and student services really cares about the welfare of the students. 

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

Yes, I am very involved currently as the ASOIT President, last year as ASOIT Communications Officer, and Media Producer for TECH Talks on campus in 2016 and 2017. I also serve on the Fiscal Operations Advisory Council, the Resource Budget Committee, and an officer for the Society of Women Engineers club on campus.

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

I have had two internships during my time at Oregon Tech. The first one in the summer of 2016 was at the Heart and Vascular Institute at Providence St. Vincent as a data reporting intern. The second one was the following summer in 2017 at Huron Consulting. After that internship Huron offered me a permanent position and I have accepted it!

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

My plans are to work for Huron Consulting and grow my career with them. After settling in to my job, I will look for a suitable graduate school to get my masters in Health Informatics.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

The campus in Wilsonville is small, but there is a great community of people here. Most of the students are commuters and it is difficult to get together with fellow students when everyone has a different schedule. It is advisable to join a club and get involved to meet other students. This is part of why I am an ASOIT officer, so that we can provide opportunities for students to connect with each other and with staff.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: The best part of my program is that it starts the students off the first term taking key classes.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I was looking for a school that would allow me to really excel in software engineering and set me up to do anything I want in computer industry.  Oregon Tech and Klamath Falls also offered something completely different than any other college I looked at, and that was a down to earth community dedicated to working hard at school and learning how to do the job right.  

What do you like most about your program?

The best part of my program is that it starts the students off the first term taking key classes.  What this means is that even as a Freshman and Sophomore students have a chance to apply to internships in Software Engineering.  By the time the student is a Junior they are ready to apply to major internships.  By the time the student is a Senior, they are ready to contribute to a company as a full time employee.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I am passionate about changing communication and leadership in this field because I feel that most people in the field struggle with one or both of these topics.  With my previous experiences, I am ready to affect serious change in a company struggling in these areas. 

What would be your dream job?

My dream job is to own a software company that enables people to promote their own content and chase their own dreams.    

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

My favorite classes have been Vector Calculus, Grammars, and Junior Project.  Vector Calculus was a very fun math class where I learned a ton and I took the class under Professor Fogarty, who is one of my favorite math professors.  Grammars, instructed by Professor Howard, taught me a very new way to think about languages and computer science.  Junior Project has been very fun, as I work with a team to create a travel application. 

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

I wish that everyone knew how hard the students work here, and how good of an environment it is for preparing us to work for any company we could dream of working for.  The students are not great because they are all super talented, although some of the students are very talented; the students are amazing because of how they work together and overcome huge obstacles to learn and complete tasks that are well beyond most college students. 

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

Cross Country and Track Captain.  Peer tutor in LRC.  

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

I participate in Google's Engineering Practicum internship during the summer of 2017.  I learned an unbelievable amount about software engineering and about myself from the experience.  One valuable thing I learned was about working on a team to create a professional software product that is ready to sell to a customer. 

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

Take advantage of every opportunity.  Do not be afraid to work harder than anyone else.  Apply to your dream internships, and keep applying until they accept you.  Persistence is key.  Also, I love the library, so check it out!

StudentProfile.TeaserText: I enjoy that the projects we do have the potential to make people’s lives better someday.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Awards/Accomplishments while at Oregon Tech: Andy Aikenhead Scholarship, Kuonen Scholarship, OIT leadership and diversity scholarship.

Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

This school was close to where my family lives.

What do you like most about your program?

I enjoy that the projects we do have the potential to make people’s lives better someday.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I'd like to move renewable tech beyond energy to food production. My current senior project involves desalinating  water to irrigate soilized sand for crop development.

What would be your dream job?

My dream job would be to work for some sort of travel company that would send me to different places all over the world to take data or something. I'd like to work in Japan, since I enjoy their language and culture. I'm almost business ready in terms of language use, so I’d like to use those language skills somehow. 

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

Some of my favorite classes were my philosophy classes, like Philosophy of Science and Adv. Logic, because I got to talk about deeper subjects than things Engineers normally talk about. I also enjoyed my Sci-Fi lit class, because I was going through a weird poetry phase, and I got to write decent poem as a final project. I also enjoyed my PV systems class, because our teacher enthusiastically taught us the material, and we got to do side research projects. I also studied abroad twice in Japan, and I loved my Japanese classes so much I've decided to move there and work after I graduate.

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

I plan to teach English in Japan until my Japanese is sufficient for working in a Japanese engineering firm.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

I wish I'd known where the financial aid income refunds came from (mostly loans), so that I could have sent it all back to my loan providers immediately.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: The small class sizes, the low tuition cost, the location allows me to live at home with a short commute, and the focus on technology.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

The small class sizes, the low tuition cost, the location allows me to live at home with a short commute, and the focus on technology. 

What do you like most about your program?

The small class sizes and the creativity surrounding programming in general. There are so many possibilities in the software realm and it is exciting to learn more about it.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I am passionate about Android apps mainly. Almost everyone has a smartphone and there is a limitless amount of apps for them all. I just like to experiment and make high quality, good looking applications.

What would be your dream job?

My dream is to be an Android app developer or a developer of Android; developing the GUI interests me the most.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

Digital Logic has been my favorite class so far because Professor Phong makes it fun and interesting. Computers are amazing machines and actually learning how they function baffles me.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

The small class sizes. When I look at other colleges they have auditoriums full of students and here the class sizes are about 20 people. It’s more comfortable and allows you to ask more questions.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

It’s affordable, has super small class sizes, is technology based, and is overall a great school.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: The professors don’t just tell you how you could do something, they show you how, and then have you go do it yourself.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?  

I chose Oregon Tech, because I had an interest in technology all throughout middle school and high school. Through high school I built computers as a hobby, and was active in my school and community, helping others with tech related issues. This developed into an interest in software development, which lead me to Oregon Tech.

What do you like most about your program?

I like that the program is so hands on. The professors don’t just tell you how you could do something, they show you how, and then have you go do it yourself. It is a really rewarding and eye opening process.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I would like to see people on the same page more often in regards to conventions and development standards. A big complaint I hear often is that people are unwilling to try development methods that make everyone’s lives easier, because they are stuck in their ways. I feel like this kind of stagnation hinders progress.

What would be your dream job?

I would love to work somewhere that is developing software that is really beneficial to the general populace. There is plenty of software out there that is just a money grab. I would rather be working on something that improves people’s quality of life.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

Data structures was simultaneously one of my favorite and least favorite classes, because it was so challenging, but also interesting. I have also really enjoyed Junior Project so far. It has been a lot of fun getting to work with other people that are passionate about software development.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

How great the professors are. They really put in a lot of work to deliver an excellent learning experience. They make you feel like you are part of a community of professionals, not just another name on a roll sheet.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

Don’t try to do everything alone, it can be very overwhelming. There are great support systems on campus from tutors to professors that want to see you succeed, don’t be afraid to ask for help.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: I was impressed with the hands-on courses, small class size, as well as their unique Renewable Energy Engineering program.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

After having an OIT representative visit my high school, I visited the both the Wilsonville and Klamath Falls Campuses. I was impressed with the hands-on courses, small class size, as well as their unique Renewable Energy Engineering program.

What do you like most about your program?

I like its size. Asking questions in the smaller class setting is very unintimidating. Also, I have been able to get to know most of my peers and professors in my program quite well.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I would like to reduce the cost of living by making homes more efficient and reducing the price of residential power systems. 

What would be your dream job?

Designing and building energy efficient homes with built-in additives such as solar thermal water heaters.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

Electrical Power is a very useful course that covers much of the information needed to get into the very large industry of electrical power. I really felt confident applying for a job with a power company after finishing this course. Also, Photovoltaic Systems is a very fun class that covers nearly every part of the PV industry from cell manufacturing to panel installation.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

The registrar's office is very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. Having a good relationship and regular interaction with these people can save you many headaches during ones’ time at OIT.

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

I am an OIT Men's rugby player which has connected me to many peers outside of my own major. I also try and attend as many other events that OIT's many clubs host to support their causes.

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

This past summer I worked at an electric bicycle shop where I was able to practice a wide variety of technical and interpersonal skills. This internship was gained by simply emailing the shop asking if they had any opportunities for me during the summer. Smaller places are often overlooked during internship searches and can be much easier to communicate with.

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

I plan on working after graduation and began applying early Fall term applying to multiple positions every week. Currently, I haven't been offered a position yet but it is very early in the hiring process for the year. 

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

Connecting with peers in your class as well as those further on in your program can make many aspects of college much easier. Making friends wasn't something I put much effort into freshman year and I struggled more than I needed to that year. Now in my senior year, there have been multiple courses that I would have likely failed if not for my friends.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: It is one of the colleges that provide a more hands-on experience for students which I really like!
StudentProfile.Biography:
Awards/Accomplishments while at Oregon Tech: I was one of the founders of Saudi Student Association at Oregon Tech 

Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

At the beginning, I chose Portland to study English as a second language. I started looking for the best colleges for engineering in the west while I was studying the language until I found Oregon Tech. I chose it because when I read about it I found that it is one of the colleges that provide a more hands-on experience for students which I really like! Also, Oregon Tech is one of only two colleges that has RRE major in the US. 

What do you like most about your program?

What I like about renewable energy engineering program is how it has the potential to help the environment and perhaps contribute to saving the planet by helping to stop global warming effects. 

What would be your dream job? 

My dream career is to be the Minister of Energy, Industry and Mineral Resources of Saudi Arabia. 

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

Math and Chemistry have been my favorite classes especially. These are the classes that I feel that I can understand and help others understand the materials more easily. Also I feel that I could be more creative and get the most out of my experience in these scopes of knowledge! 

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about? 

Yes, I want everyone to graduate from OIT. It’s the best school from my perspective. I want people to know that Oregon Tech students have a more hands-on experience while studying and actively learning how to apply what has been learned to get the most out of the learning experience! 

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

Yes, I’m a member of the International Club and the Treasurer of the Saudi Student Association and looking forward to be the president of the SSA next year.  

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation? 

After my graduation, I’m planning to get an internship and work for one to two years in the United States to get to experience the different dimensions of my major in the workplace then go back to my country and work hard for my dream job.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: I feel like they are preparing me to hit the ground running when I get into the hospital setting.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech? 
I chose Oregon Tech because it is one of the few colleges that offers a nuclear medicine program, and the program here far exceeds what other schools have to offer. The hands-on experience especially with a full year of externship clinical experience will set me up for success in my field. 

What do you like most about your program? 
I love the close-knit feel of a smaller program. We are all here for each other.  Nuclear medicine is like a second family.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?  There are so many advancements happening in nuclear medicine. I am passionate about being involved in the cutting edge of diagnostic medicine. Nuclear medicine is making incredible strides with new studies for Alzheimer's, cancer, and many others! 

What would be your dream job?
My dream job would be working for a research and teaching hospital. I would love to be involved with clinical trials for new exams in nuclear medicine. I would also love to pay it forward by teaching other students in the future when I am settled into my career.  

What have been some of your favorite classes and why? 
My favorite classes have included patient care and imaging procedures. These classes give a very real look at some of the most important aspects of what I will be doing every day at work. I feel like they are preparing me to hit the ground running when I get into the hospital setting.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about? 
I wish everyone knew how much this school has to offer. It may be small but it is mighty. It offers knowledgeable professors who truly care for their students, real equipment to train on, and a full year of externship clinical experience for medical imaging students. Not to mention the outdoor life here in Oregon is absolutely beautiful! 

Are you involved on campus? If so, how? 
I am currently the President of the Nuclear Medicine club here on campus. I try to stay involved with the campus as well as my community. There are so many options for getting involved. 

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them? 
I have spent time time doing clinical rotations at Sky Lakes medical center in nuclear medicine, CT, and MRI. They have provided be with invaluable experience. This summer, I will be leaving for a full year of externship as my senior year in nuclear medicine. By the time I graduate, I will have a full year of work experience under my belt making me a great job candidate. 

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation? 
I hope to get a full time job at a nuclear medicine department. I am an adventurous soul, so I am open to taking a job anywhere in the country. Adventure awaits!

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else? 
I wish I had known a lot sooner that Oregon Tech offered a full bachelor's degree in nuclear medicine technology. This program has incredible success rates for passing board examinations and job placement. They are truly invested in making sure their students have all the tools they need to succeed.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: There was no better school for me than OIT where I get a top notch education in all the skills I would need to move forward with my goal.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

When I left the military I knew I wanted to keep helping people and working in healthcare. When I looked at how I might want to do that, I realized that building better healthcare systems will let people be more in control of their own health. I don’t think there’s any more help I could give than to try and give people more efficacy in how they are cared for. I also realized that there was no better school for me than OIT where I get a top notch education in all the skills I would need to move forward with my goal.

What do you like most about your program?

The fact that I can see why I’m taking every class I’m taking. Not everyone pertains to my particular goal, but everyone goes towards making me a well-rounded tech entrepreneur not just a guy who can work a computer.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I want to give control back to the people. 

What would be your dream job?

I’d like to work for EPIC health systems and moonlight as a free information advocate.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

I love SQL programming; Lindy is an awesome teacher. I really enjoyed technical writing, which was a surprise actually. It gave me a whole new way to express myself and my ideas.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

That it existed and that it’s great school. People know about U of O and OSU, some even know about PSU, but not very many people realize that we have a great school right in Oregon that can help you become a mover and a shaker in the tech world.

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

I’m a dad so I have to give what free time I have to my 1-year-old. I want her to be able to see that hard work will get you ahead in life.

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

I’m about to start working part time with OCHIN and I’d love to continue after graduation.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

This is an awesome school with teachers and staff that want to see you succeed. There’s something here for everyone so try things out, because it’s rare that you get access to as many top notch labs and educators so take advantage.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: Externship creates a "whole package" experience to my education.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Awards/Accomplishments while at Oregon Tech: Circle K Club Vice President, Citizens for Safe Schools Mentor, Nuclear Medicine Club Member, a cumulative 3.8 GPA, AA in business administration, minor in human interactions, and I am a Ford Family Restart Scholarship recipient.

Why did you choose Oregon Tech? 

Oregon Tech's reputation for excellence is second to none. The employment rate for all the medical imaging programs, after graduating OIT, is incredible ranging above 90%.

What do you like most about your program?

My favorite part of my program is the year-long externship. I have learned so much during my externship and it has made me fall even more in love with nuclear medicine. I appreciate that the nuclear medicine program has high expectations for its students. 

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I want to be the best tech for my patients. So often people in the medical field forget how it is to be a patient. I plan to stay compassionate and empathetic. 

What would be your dream job?

Nuclear Medicine Technologist with a secondary certification in computed tomography. 

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

My favorite classes were my imaging procedures classes where we learned to perform the procedures we practice in a clinical setting. I also enjoyed my communications courses that went towards my minor. 

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about? 

This school is for people who are ready to work hard and achieve their goals. If you take your time at OIT seriously, you will be able to have a career that you love and are very knowledgeable in.

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

Before externship, I was involved with 2 clubs on campus, the nuclear medicine club & Circle K (a community service club). I am also a TOP program member.

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

I am currently on my 11-month externship with Kaiser Permanente in the Portland area. I have made leaps and bounds in my knowledge of the field through my clinical experience. Classes can never quite prepare you for real world applications, externship sort of creates a "whole package" experience to my education. 

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

The time at OIT is short and I would recommend to be as active as possible in school activities. Once you get in a program, keep your peers close, they are the only ones who can relate to what you are going through and can be a huge help to you.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: What I like most about the Information Technology, Management program is it’s so diverse.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I chose Oregon Tech because it’s my dream school for my career choice. When I decided I wanted to be an Information Technology major, OIT was the obvious decision. I’ve heard nothing but good things about the school and was ecstatic when I received my acceptance letter.

What do you like most about your program?

What I like most about the Information Technology, Management program is it’s so diverse. It touches on a wide variety of different elements of the IT profession. It allows students to truly find their focus in the IT world, which I think is an incredible thing. Plus, the advisors are great!

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why? 

What I am passionate about changing within the IT field is making it more personable. What I mean when I say “personable” is that I want to make it more social and fun. I love the analytical skills I’m learning as well as the psychology & sociological aspects of working in a business environment. I think interactions with our coworkers and end-users is always very important in the end.

What would be your dream job?

My dream job would be anything that involved technology and music. I’m a musician who loves creating, performing, and writing music. So, being able to blend the two fields together would be awesome. However, I’m going to school to become either an Information Security Analyst or a Computer Systems Analyst. 

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

I would say my favorite classes so far at Oregon Tech have been MIS 145, BUS 215, and MIS 102. All three of those classes had great professors and great class content. I learned a lot about networking, business, data entry practices, and more great skills that I’ve utilized in my everyday work at my job. 

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about? 

What I wish everyone knew about Oregon Tech is really how great of a school it is. With a wide variety of courses, disciplines, and opportunities it truly is an incredible school for anybody looking to grow academically. 

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

I am not involved on campus because of my work schedule, but I would like to be if I could. Like a lot of the students attending the Portland-Metro campus, I work full-time while going to school. So, being involved on campus is something I would definitely like to do if I had the free time. OIT offers a lot of great ways to get involved!

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them? 

I have not participated in any internships or externships while going to Oregon Tech but I am currently working in my career field. This has given me a lot of insight on my career and has let me utilize what I have learned at OIT in real life. 

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation? 

When it comes to what I want to do after graduation, I always like the idea of continuing my education and doing graduate school to get a Master’s degree. However, currently I want to graduate with my Bachelor of Science in Information Technology, Management and then work as either an Information Security Analyst or a Computer Systems Analyst. 

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

If you have the opportunity to go to Oregon Institute of Technology, do it. It’s an incredible school with everything you could ask for with a college education experience. Great professors, great curriculum, lots of great ways to get/stay connected, and many more. If you want to get a great education, go to Oregon Tech!

StudentProfile.TeaserText: My favorite thing about my program is the professors, they all have many years of work experience and that shows in what they teach us.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I chose Oregon Tech because they have one of the best civil engineering departments in the state. Also being from a small town the small class sizes really appealed to me.

What do you like most about your program?

My favorite thing about my program is the professors, they all have many years of work experience and that shows in what they teach us. They also all know everyone by their first name and are always willing to help when you have questions.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I really want to change how people are transported from place to place. The current system was not built to hand the amount of people that use it and I want to change that. If people can change how they use transportation then we might be able to end traffic jams, and who doesn’t want that to happen?

What would be your dream job?

I have two “dream” jobs, the first is to be a race car driver and the second is to be a professional basketball referee. The more realistic dream job I have is to be a city planner for a small city in rural Oregon.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

My favorite class is pavement engineering. In this class I got to get my hands dirty and mix different asphalt designs. I also got to test one mix design for its resistants’ to rutting as part of my masters project to see how it would perform in the real world. 

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

I wish everyone knew just how great this school is.  It doesn’t matter who you talk to everyone thinks their major is the best major on camps, which speaks to how great all the professors are, even though civil engineering is defiantly the best major!  

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

I am the current president to of the schools ITE (institute of transportation engineers) student chapter. As a member of ITE I have been able to travel across the country to attend conferences about transportation. I am also a student ambassador, so I give campus tours as well as help people trying to apply fill out there application and answer any question they have. 

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

I have had three summer internships while at Oregon Tech. I have been a field engineer on a paving project in Denver, CO. I have also worked on the Hwy 53 realignment in Northern Minnesota, where I was field engineer during the construction of the tallest bridge in Minnesota.

Do you have employment/graduate school plans for after graduation?

After I graduate from Oregon Tech with my master’s degree in civil engineering I plan on going to work in Northern Oregon. I would like to work for a transportation firm designing intersections.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else? 

The one regret I have from college is not getting involved sooner. I wish I had joined ITE or any other club sooner, because I have had so much fun while being in a club I can only imagine what I missed out on. You also have more free time as a freshman and sophomore to do club events so join a club sooner than later.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: I feel like I’ve gained more solid skills in one year here than I did in four years at my last school.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I had heard a little about Oregon Tech in the past, but when I was given a tour and told what the programs were like, I immediately wanted to be here. On the tour, a professor excitedly pulled us into a classroom to demonstrate an experiment with light and reflectors they were preparing for their next class. The school and the professors are serious about helping you learn, and they’re excited about what they teach.

What do you like most about your program?

As a sophomore, I still have a lot to learn, but I feel like I’ve gained more solid skills in one year here than I did in four years at my last school. Everything we do is hands-on, the professors are all highly knowledgeable, and the projects are just plain fun.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

I may just be a geek, but I feel like there’s so much technology has to offer if we know how to use it. I want to encourage people to learn more about technology and computer science, to show them that it’s not as scary or complicated as it’s often made out to be. When people embrace technology and tinker with it, they can create really incredible things.

What would be your dream job?

I really want to do something that I can be proud of, something that has an impact on the world. I see companies like Tesla and SpaceX pushing the boundaries of what we thought was possible, or giants like Google, Amazon, Facebook, and Microsoft impacting the daily lives of billions of people. I want to be a part of something like that.

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

So far, Data Structures is my absolute favorite class. I had heard from everyone that had taken it before that it is the most difficult class in the program; If I didn’t truly want to be a software engineer, it would push me out, but I love it. I get to code and design these complex structures that handle and manipulate whatever data I can throw at it, and then use them to build games and even more advanced structures.

Is there anything about Oregon Tech that you wish everyone knew about?

The professors are all experts in their field, and almost every one of them has many years of experience in industry. Because of this, they teach differently than other schools. Where other schools focus on theory, we focus on understanding, practice, and implementation; We learn how to do what will be required of us once we graduate.

Are you involved on campus? If so, how?

I’m part of the RockSat-C program, which is part of the Gravity and Space club (GRASP). The team is designing and building several experiments that will be launched into space through a collaboration with NASA. As part of the software team, we are responsible for creating software that will run on Arduino and Raspberry Pi to collect and store data from several different experiments at once.

Have you participated in any internships or externships during your time at Oregon Tech? Did you gain valuable experience from them?

I’m currently interning at an engineering firm in Wilsonville, and it’s the greatest work experience I’ve had. Before this, I had always heard horror stories about internships, having to fetch coffee and run personal errands, etc. It’s nothing like that, you actually learn valuable skills and make some real connections with people in your field, all while earning a pretty good paycheck. Don’t wait to apply for them.

Is there anything more that you would like to share with future students about campus, what you wish you knew before attending Oregon Tech or anything else?

My previous education was in the social sciences and it did not prepare me for an engineering program. Be prepared to work harder than you ever have, but it is 100% worth it. Becoming an engineer is the best decision I ever made, and Oregon Tech is a great place to study.

StudentProfile.TeaserText: OIT’s atmosphere is extremely welcoming, and unlike larger colleges, students and faculty have more autonomy and have closer relationships providing better education.
StudentProfile.Biography:
Why did you choose Oregon Tech?

I chose Oregon Tech because its well known for its hands-on learning experience and smaller classroom sizes. This has allowed me to make deeper connections with my professors, and allows me to thrive in the classroom.

What do you like most about your program?

I like that we have full access to the lab 7 days a week and most hours of the day. This allows for students with all different schedules to practice scanning and work on assignments at their own convenience.

What are you passionate about changing within this particular field and why?

The continuing innovation of ultrasound machines is something that I’m very passionate about. After I become an experienced cardiac sonographer, I would enjoy having the opportunity to connect with manufacturing companies to help improve ergonomic design and user interfaces. 

What would be your dream job?

Working for a progressive hospital that uses cutting edge technology and serves a diverse population.  

What have been some of your favorite classes and why?

So far echocardiography courses have been my favorite. I did also enjoy Cardiac Physiology which focused primarily on cardiovascular fluid dynamics.
